Text:
LIVE NOW on Facebook: Join me and experts in the field for a town hall on Mental Health, COVID, and the African American Community. https://t.co/ezLJcowwLo
You can also follow along to our PowerPoint presentation at:
https://t.co/dMdukHxyoM
Curlie has worked tirelessly to help make Pittsburg a better place and we are thrilled to honor her today. (4/4)

She has also been recognized by the Pittsburg Unified School District, Pittsburg City Council, East County NAACP, and the Contra Costa County Board of Supervisors for her outstanding efforts to improve the Pittsburg community and for her invaluable service. (3/4)

She worked for the Pittsburg Unified School District for 35 years and also worked with Better Together Pittsburg Community. She is the longest living member and former President of the East County NAACP. (2/4)
This week we are pleased to recognize Curlie B. Jackson in celebration of #BlackHistoryMonth. Curlie is a Pittsburg resident and a dedicated civil rights activist. (1/4) https://t.co/4GHvlw3UOk
LAST CHANCE: RSVP before 10:00 a.m. to join our town hall at noon on Mental Health, COVID, and the African American Community. To RSVP, please visit https://t.co/EkE6QZ1MRP https://t.co/j20ZzUhfIU

Today, I introduced the National Public Health Act, which would help protect American consumers by requiring companies to pay for the damage they are causing – either with financial restitution or by offsetting their negative impacts.
Every year, large corporations earn billions of dollars in profit selling products, like oil, tobacco, opioids, that harm our public health – they must be held accountable.

As California Uber and Lyft drivers fight for their right to unionize, I spoke with @BobEgelko of the @SFChronicle about the importance of unionizing in an increasingly complex economy. You can read more at the link below.
https://t.co/kDsakOz1Ob
Please visit https://t.co/EkE6QZ1MRP to RSVP. We look forward to seeing you there!

The coronavirus pandemic is heavily impacting communities of color physically and mentally. TOMORROW at 12 pm we’re hosting a virtual town hall to discuss this important topic with Gigi Crowder from NAMI California and Dr. Nicola Parr of the Solano County Department of Education. https://t.co/bXCkw3e1h1

On Wednesday, February 23rd at 12 p.m. PT I will be hosting a town hall on mental health, COVID, and the African American community. Visit https://t.co/EkE6QZ1MRP to sign up. We hope to see you there! #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/CtXVQanqyK

#PresidentsDay is an opportunity to reflect on the legacy set by the great leaders in our nation’s history who have held that sacred office and worked to unite us. I hope that you all have a restful and happy President’s Day!
Enjoying the sunshine with North at #MtDiablo State Park. We are so fortunate to have such amazing parks and natural beauty here in our district. https://t.co/k3n0xS6XMI

I will continue my work on @OversightDems to hold the Sackler family accountable because victims deserve better than a system that allows a corrupt family worth $11 billion to buy their way out of consequences.

The Sackler family is responsible for fueling the opioid crisis, causing the death of hundreds of thousands of Americans. They must not be allowed any settlement that shields them from liability. Their victims deserve justice in a court of law. https://t.co/pXXxL93rVP
I will be joined by NAMI California and Dr. Nicola Parr of the Solano County Department of Education who will offer their expertise and take your questions.

To commemorate #BlackHistoryMonth, I will be hosting a virtual town hall focused on the mental health impacts of the coronavirus pandemic in the African American community on Wednesday, February 23rd at 12 p.m. PT. To RSVP, please visit https://t.co/EkE6QZ1MRP. https://t.co/cdQwBvVOL2
Tune in to learn more.⬆️

Busy week as we hosted a town hall to discuss voting in Contra Costa, I chaired an @EdLaborCmte to explore how we can ensure every American has affordable health coverage, and @OversightDems held a hearing on the situation in Ukraine as we work to preserve global security. https://t.co/dJhF1AXaiM
He worked tirelessly to revitalize the Coronado neighborhood and serves as an outstanding role model for our community. #BlackHistoryMonth

Joe has used his business acumen to lobby local officials for increased government support and to encourage businesses and nonprofits to provide scholarship opportunities for Coronado residents. #BlackHistoryMonth

Today we're pleased to recognize Joe Fisher, a Real Estate Broker from Richmond & leader in our community. Joe is President of the Coronado Neighborhood Council & a proud life-long Richmond resident who has always been passionate about improving his community. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/1eFl3LnUnC
LAST CHANCE: RSVP before 10:00 a.m. to join our town hall at noon on voting in Contra Costa. To RSVP, please visit https://t.co/EkE6QZ1MRP https://t.co/Ls6V30cRdw
Tune in for a snapshot of the hearing about how we can reach universal coverage.⬆️

Today I had the honor of chairing the @EdLaborCmte Subcommittee on Health, Employment, Labor, and Pensions hearing to discuss the action Congress can and must take to ensure the right to health care is a reality for every American. https://t.co/1YPjRNKCQI
To schedule an appointment, RSVP before 6:00 p.m. TODAY at CA11.RSVP@mail.house.gov.

On Tuesday, February 22nd from 3:30 – 5 p.m. I will be hosting Virtual District Office Hours. I want to hear from you, answer your questions about legislation, and discuss how our office can assist with federal issues like IRS, immigration, and Social Security. https://t.co/taC7I1jZGG
We look forward to seeing you there!

TOMORROW at 12 p.m. PT we’re hosting a virtual town hall to discuss voting and elections in Contra Costa. Please visit https://t.co/EkE6QZjnJn to RSVP. I will be joined by officials from the Contra Costa County Elections Division who will offer their expertise & take questions. https://t.co/AFDXqwTgEL
One of the best parts of 2021 was adding North to our family! Looking forward to spending more time with him on new adventures together in 2022. https://t.co/tGM4LwnBYn

As the U.S. stands up for our European allies against Putin’s aggression, I’m grateful to serve on the @OversightDems Subcommittee on National Security where we work to help preserve global peace. https://t.co/OFUVAoqYAV
Appointments are first come, first served – RSVP before 6:00 pm TOMORROW for a one-on-one meeting with me at CA11.RSVP@mail.house.gov. I hope to see you there!

Virtual District Office Hours are back Tuesday, February 22nd from 3:30 – 5:00 p.m! I want to hear from you, answer your questions on legislation, and discuss how our office can assist with federal issues like IRS, immigration, and Social Security. https://t.co/Wpo7rh1xv2
As a member of @EdLaborCmte, I am proud to support our teachers by ensuring they have the resources and support they need to help students thrive in the classroom.

During #LoveTeaching Week, we celebrate all of the dedicated teachers across the country and the critical work they do in educating young people and setting them up for bright futures. https://t.co/XnnnZ6zDoQ

Today the families of #SandyHook victims reached a historic settlement with Remington Arms - a victory for justice that holds a gun manufacturer accountable for the destruction their product inflicted.
https://t.co/EJuLNX1lox

Have questions about voting in Contra Costa County? Join us on Friday, February 18th at 12 p.m. PT for a town hall with special guests from the Contra Costa County Elections Division. Visit https://t.co/EkE6QZjnJn to sign up. We hope to see you there! https://t.co/ovV0mkknJa
Proud to receive 100% on the 2021 #HumaneScorecard and eager to continue supporting pro-animal legislation in Congress. @HSLegFund https://t.co/TzizE9ntwJ

The group provides a wide array of essential services such as food, housing, transportation, counseling services, and classes on social justice, political engagement, and more. Dr. Frazier’s advocacy continues has been monumental in aiding black residents of East County.
Village Keepers’ goal is to establish a network of organizations and allies in order to empower residents of East County.

This week we're celebrating the leadership of Dr. Carrie Frazier as part of #BlackHistoryMonth. Dr. Frazier is the founder of Village Keepers, a nonprofit organization with a focus on fostering economic stability & improving the health & safety of black families in East @CCCounty https://t.co/6nL0BAqxG0
This #ValentinesDay take care of yourself & your loved ones by making health a priority and learning what screenings you & your loved ones are eligible for. #CongressionalFamilies @PreventCancer
To RSVP, please visit https://t.co/EkE6QZ1MRP.

I will be hosting a virtual town hall to discuss voting and elections in Contra Costa County on Friday, February 18th at 12 p.m. PT where local officials from the Contra Costa County Elections Division will offer their expertise and take your questions. https://t.co/KizRF5qmUl

Did you know 1 in 6 Californians in the baby boomer generation will develop Alzheimer’s? It is clear we need to make additional investments in the research and treatment critical to providing care and supporting patients. @CMSGOV

Four years ago, 17 lives were cut short at #Parkland by someone who never should have had access to a gun. We will never forget what happened and we will never stop fighting to enact meaningful gun safety reforms to ensure it never happens again. #MSDStrong https://t.co/hfTkggnSxD

Tune in for updates on Congress’ bipartisan work this week to stand up for victims of sexual harassment and to keep our government funded, and for a preview of upcoming town halls and events we are hosting soon. Hope you have a fun and relaxing weekend! https://t.co/TwtMu7px42
This is a huge step toward ensuring a clean-energy future in California and an initiative I have been working to build out nationwide.

California continues to lead the way in innovation and climate action! Very proud as our state becomes the first to reach 1 million registered plug-in cars.
https://t.co/M4UhFAcphP
https://t.co/ICjVFKBd9A

Proud to join @SenAlexPadilla in leading California Democrats in encouraging @USDOT to prioritize transportation projects that would advance clean energy projects, improve air quality, & mitigate the effects of climate change – all modeled off my Clean Corridors program.

I’m proud to support the #GlobalRespectAct and stand up for the #LGBTQ+ community. By passing this bill, we reaffirm that hate and intolerance should have no place in the United States or around the globe. https://t.co/vGENrmVH5s

Today, @OversightDems held a hearing on Big Oil’s role in fueling the climate crisis. Tune in as I speak with experts about how these companies lied to the American public to turn a profit & the action we must take to hold them accountable. https://t.co/uH2s4jfpfT

On #SaferInternetDay, I'm joining @RepSusanWild in calling on @Youtube to take a simple, yet potentially lifesaving action: take down "How To Tie a Noose" videos. At a time when adolescent suicide rates are on the rise, taking this step could save lives. #TakeThemDown https://t.co/gqwv4Is8eO

.@USPS delivers life-saving medications, urgent packages, and much more to Americans across the country. Today, I am supporting the #PostalServiceReformAct to ensure USPS can continue these critical operations for years to come. https://t.co/qMX4uGB7qi

Proud to receive a 100% rating from The Leadership Conference on Civil and Human Rights. Working in Congress to advance justice and equity is my top priority. Together, we can create an America that lives up to its highest ideals. https://t.co/FfB5bFk0tg
It was a pleasure to join @AntiochCAgov on the city’s 150th anniversary yesterday and to celebrate its rich history. https://t.co/HcT7S9e55O
I proudly voted today to #EndForcedArbitration to help ensure justice for victims of sexual harassment in the workplace. https://t.co/VebiT2u3aD
I look forward to continuing to work with the Administration on this.

As a cancer survivor and founder of the Cancer Survivors Caucus, I know how critical government investment in research is to saving lives. I'm excited @POTUS has relaunched the Cancer Moonshot Initiative to marshal resources toward finding a cure. https://t.co/ysGu9kxeES

During her time as mayor, Irma was instrumental in developing after-school programs for Richmond students. Her work inspires us all and continues to have a long-lasting impact on Richmond today. (3/3)

She eventually developed an interest in politics and became the first black woman to serve on Richmond’s City Council. Irma was also Mayor of Richmond from 2001-2006, making her the first black woman to be elected as mayor of a major California city. (2/3)

Today we recognize Irma Anderson as we honor African American leaders in our community throughout #BlackHisotryMonth. Irma moved to Richmond in 1959, working as a registered nurse. (1/3) https://t.co/iqpUsBPkFx
I was proud to show @SecMartyWalsh this training center when he visited @CCCounty last summer and am so pleased to see it continue its important work.

Thrilled to learn RichmondBUILD has been awarded $200,000 in grant funding from @EPA to help provide job training in the renewable energy field - a huge step in furthering environmental justice for the Richmond community. https://t.co/wgWsH3wlqa

It’s been 29 years since the passage of the Family and Medical Leave Act, but roughly 50% of workers still can’t afford to take leave without pay. While #FMLA was a good first step, we must pass #PaidLeaveForAll to bring about true economic justice. @FamilyValuesWork

Congratulations to Alysa Liu from Richmond who will be competing in the 2022 Winter Olympics’ Women’s Figure Skating. CA-11 is rooting for you!
https://t.co/TMuSJurOXf

This week, the House passed the #COMPETESAct to ensure America remains competitive in the 21st century. Our office also authored two bills to address childhood mental health needs and to increase early support for children with disabilities. Tune in to learn more! https://t.co/8HoIKXhbZV

The #AmericaCOMPETES Act would ensure the U.S. remains a global leader in innovation and clean energy production by funding STEM education, investing in climate research, and incentivizing American manufacturing. Proud to help pass this bill to make these critical investments. https://t.co/AwDvedlKdM

During #GunViolenceSurvivors Week, we recognize those who, despite enduring great loss, work to ensure no one else goes through the same. I am inspired by the fortitude of my colleague @RepLucyMcBath who works tirelessly every day to #EndGunViolence following personal tragedy.

Today is #WorldCancerDay, an opportunity to spread awareness of cancer’s global impact & acknowledge the disparities in access to cancer treatment. As a cancer survivor, I am passionate about working to #closethegap in care and ensure that everyone has access to affordable care. https://t.co/I50tfTmKsL
His leadership and character have been instrumental in promoting equity and justice in East County. (4/4)

In 2008, Willie was awarded the “one time only” Dr. Martin Luther King Freedom Fighter Award. In 2013, he began working on the African-American male Achievement Initiative with Antioch schools to help end disparities in black students’ education. (3/4)

Mims first became interested in politics in 1963 supporting the Rumford Fair Housing Act which aimed to stop racial discrimination in housing. To this day, Willie is deeply involved in local politics, promoting ideals of justice to local city councils and school boards. (2/4)

As part of our efforts to honor African American leaders in @CCCounty throughout #BlackHistoryMonth, today we recognize Willie Mims. Willie is a community activist from East Contra Costa County and member of the East County NAACP and Pittsburg’s Black Political Association. (1/4) https://t.co/br9vixweYx
#GVSurvivorsWeek @Everytown @MomsDemand

Gun violence disproportionately affects Black Americans with 68% of adults in this community being survivors of gun violence themselves or caring for someone impacted by gun violence. This is completely unacceptable & I’m proud to work every day to strengthen our gun safety laws. https://t.co/QnVifSiFLj
Kayleen was 5 years old. Stories like Kayleen’s could be prevented with better gun regulation. We cannot let this happen to more families. @Everytown @MomsDemand

During Gun Violence Survivors’ Week, we must keep in mind that gun violence affects every community in the U.S. In May, 2018, Kayleen Lor was celebrating Mother’s Day at her grandmother’s home in Stockton when a gunman shot & killed her, her mother, and father. #GVSurvivorsWeek https://t.co/kSbUC8fAI1

The pandemic has further revealed the critical need for mental health resources for students. Proud to introduce an effort that would help more children get more behavioral health services ensuring early education childhood centers have the resources they need. @KTVU https://t.co/sgRGTPzHyB

While exploring the benefits of autonomous vehicles is important, we must ensure no workers are left behind in a transition. We appreciate Bay Area native Doug Bloch for sharing the perspective of American workers at today’s @TransportDems hearing. https://t.co/9GrZT1dPLE
https://t.co/ypKfFAkScd

If we work together, we can put an end to cancer. As a cancer survivor myself & founder & co-chair of the Congressional Cancer Survivors Caucus, I could not be more delighted that @POTUS re-launched the Cancer Moonshot Initiative with the goal of ending cancer as we know it.
Proud to join @RepRubenGallego in leading the effort to ensure our servicemembers receive the full benefits they are entitled to for their service to our nation. https://t.co/0PKEHUhv7l

@NAMIAdvocacy @APA @HealthyAmerica1 @ZEROTOTHREE @afspnational @firstfiveyears @Campaign4Kids @DC_AMCHP
https://t.co/7bqNtTuYpJ

The importance of strong behavioral health support from an early age cannot be overstated. That’s why I’m proud to introduce with @dorismatsui & @RepPressley an effort to bolster the mental health services provided to children in Head Start and early childhood education centers.
Happy #LunarNewYear! May the Year of the Tiger be one of peace and prosperity for you and your family. https://t.co/INKW0nyBIg

Proud to partner with @RepHuffman, @RodneyDavis, and @SenatorHassan in introducing the Funding Early Childhood is the Right IDEA Act to ensure the programs that make these services possible are fully funded.

One of the most important things we can do to support children with disabilities is ensure that they have equal access to quality early childhood and educational services that will set them up for success. 
https://t.co/PHb5AxCFtd
I’ve introduced the CEO Accountability and Responsibility Act to address this rampant inequality and restore the balance of power to workers.

It’s disgraceful that while millions of working Americans struggle to make ends meet, the CEOs of the companies that employ them earn 351 times more than them on average. 
https://t.co/N95yw8O12p

To better understand the full impact of telecommuting, I am joining @BobbyScott and @RepMaloney in requesting that @USGAO evaluate the benefits of telework models to help support workers and communities.

Throughout the pandemic, we’ve seen how telework can increase productivity and benefit both employers and workers. But did you know it has also decreased traffic, improved air quality, and increased access to health care? https://t.co/iXrhHDRSrU
The data is clear: gun safety laws save lives.

In the U.S., 110 people lose their lives to gun violence every day and hundreds more are injured. These are not just numbers – these are mothers, fathers, children, and friends whose lives are cut short by gun violence. #GVSurvivorsWeek @Everytown @MomsDemand https://t.co/RaFKa86wtb
We love exploring our beautiful local parks with North! Wanted to share a shot from this weekend of North checking out the squirrels – one of his favorite pastimes. https://t.co/ZMrGzClV3u
Our office is proud to recognize this remarkable community leader who stands as an example for fighting injustice. (4/4)

McMillan is also a fierce advocate for racial justice, equity, and police reform. In 1983, McMillan was elected as a councilmember for the City of Richmond. He served the community in this role from 1983-1995. (3/4)

Jim McMillan moved from Portland, Oregon to Richmond in 1954 where he worked in the medical field, at Brookside and other clinics around the county. In 1960, he purchased a building downtown and became the first black pharmacist in the city. (2/4) https://t.co/1aI6upXgtu

In honor of #BlackHistoryMonth, throughout the month of February our office will be highlighting some of the many African American leaders in our community. I am proud to represent a district with such a diverse and rich history as #CA11. (1/4)

Today is the LAST DAY to enroll for coverage through @CoveredCA! Sign up today to ensure you have access to comprehensive, affordable check-ups in 2022 through #CoveredCA by visiting https://t.co/7BuTe4SfFw
Good luck to the @49ers going against the Rams in the NFC Championship. Let’s go Niners!

This morning I spoke with @GillianHTurner @FoxNews about @POTUS’s steadfast response to Russian aggression toward Ukraine.
https://t.co/JV8I4eXsiW
I am proud to continue the efforts of my predecessor Congressman George Miller, Chairman of the House Education and Labor Committee and chief sponsor of this bill in the House.

Although much progress has been made, 13 years after the passage of the #LillyLedbetter Fair Pay Act the gender pay gap persists, especially for women of color. That is unacceptable. On this important anniversary we reiterate our commitment to ensuring #equalpay for equal work. https://t.co/A9X6L8d4x6

Following passage of the historic bipartisan infrastructure bill, I spoke with @TalKopan about the role we’re playing to ensure these funds are allocated to best serve our community and make a difference in the everyday lives of working Americans.

https://t.co/rrrPyHSiWz https://t.co/Zmp6lZj2Jh

Tune in to our weekly update to hear about our first town hall of 2022 where @RepBarbaraLee and I discussed Democrats’ efforts to protect the right to vote and to learn more about the work being done in Congress and in Contra Costa to improve our infrastructure. https://t.co/r2DmyFQYzp

The James Webb Space Telescope is an incredible achievement and testament to the power of cooperation and unity. I loved reading about this remarkable feat and thought you might too: https://t.co/t7W8JK6F2U

The Bureau of International Labor Affairs is essential in the fight against child & forced labor, & to enforce fair trade & promote equitable labor standards. Proud to introduce a bipartisan effort with @RepWalberg to ensure the Bureau can continue these operations. @EdLaborCmte
As the Chair of the Health, Employment, Labor, and Pensions Subcommittee, this is one of my top priorities.

It was a pleasure to participate in a Retirement Security Roundtable with @RepRickAllen to discuss the recently passed RISE Act and bipartisan work in Congress to ensure every American can retire with dignity. @FundingFutureUS https://t.co/dXWXviR8dH
You can also review the presentation from this event here: https://t.co/kxIi2cKTgU

ICYMI: Last night, @RepBarbaraLee and I held a town hall to discuss Democrats’ efforts to protect the right of every American to make their voice heard at the ballot box as voting rights are under attack across the country. Tune in: https://t.co/trKi8jwKZH

LIVE NOW on my Facebook page: @RepBarbaraLee, @UCBerkeley Professor Eric Schickler, and I discuss House Democrats’ work to put an end to voter suppression and restore every American’s right to vote. https://t.co/ezLJcox4AW

On #HolocaustRemembranceDay we recognize and mourn the lives tragically lost during the Holocaust. We must ensure atrocities like this are never repeated and remain vigilant in the fight against anti-Semitism and hate. https://t.co/NSVycAXRTU

LAST CHANCE: RSVP before 5:00 p.m. PT for tonight’s town hall on voting rights with @repBarbaraLee and @UCBerkeley Professor Eric Schickler. Visit https://t.co/EkE6QZjnJn to sign up or submit a question. https://t.co/4YN9ceyp79
Congratulations to this year’s winner, Seth Raphael, for his app LinkJoin!

Tonight our office hosted a virtual reception to showcase all of the remarkable submissions for the 2021 Congressional App Challenge. It was such a pleasure to see the innovation and creativity displayed by students in #CA11. https://t.co/jdkaHdZbvH

Thanks to the American Rescue Plan, a record 1.8 million people have signed up for health care through @CoveredCA. Make sure you’re covered in 2022 & enroll before the end of the month: https://t.co/7BuTe4SfFw
#CoveredCA
Proud to have supported efforts in Congress to ensure the U.S. acts as a leader in the fight to end the pandemic globally. https://t.co/efRnuzoOdp
To learn more about what’s being done to ensure your voice and the voice of every American is heard, RSVP at https://t.co/EkE6QZ1MRP.

TOMORROW at 7:15 p.m. I am hosting a town hall with @RepBarbaraLee and @UCBerkeley Political Science Professor Eric Schickler to discuss efforts in Congress to combat attacks on the constitutional right to vote. @RichmondStandard
https://t.co/PEHo3aLSIi https://t.co/EBSRLZhGRW
To RSVP and submit a question, visit https://t.co/EkE6QZ1MRP

With voting rights under attack across the country, please join me, @RepBarbaraLee, & @UCBerkeley Political Science Professor Eric Schickler Thursday, Jan. 27 at 7:15 pm for a town hall to discuss Democrats’ efforts to protect this right & ensure every American’s voice is heard. https://t.co/0dikm6aaHn

Congrats @49ers on an amazing win and best of luck in the NFC championship!
https://t.co/4sp4R0tLzy
.@WhiteHouse has launched a phone line for Americans to order their free at-home covid test kits. You can call 1-800-232-0233 from 8 a.m. – 12 a.m. EST seven days a week or text 1-888-720-7489.

On the 49th anniversary of #RoeVWade, the constitutional right to an abortion is under attack, jeopardizing the health of over 36 million Americans. I stand with them in the fight to preserve reproductive freedom by working to pass the Women’s Health Protection Act to codify #Roe

Since then:
     ✔️210 million Americans vaccinated
     ✔️6.4 million jobs created
     ✔️Passed biggest infrastructure bill in decades
Tune in for more on this and our work ahead.
This week marked one year of @HouseDemocrats working with @POTUS to recover from the pandemic and deliver historic support for American families. https://t.co/CFFm3Nlm49
To reduce violence across the country, @HouseDemocrats are working to implement these commonsense measures nationwide.

States with weaker gun safety laws have higher rates of homicide & suicide. Meanwhile, California, thanks to commonsense laws, has the lowest rate of gun-related deaths. @MomsDemand @Everytown 
https://t.co/Hp4kSuXFOA

The men and women who serve our country deserve comprehensive, quality health care, including mental health support. Today, I was proud to vote to pass the EVEST Act, which would make it easier for veterans to access this care. https://t.co/naygd6Fnwv

As Republicans in Congress are blocking commonsense reforms to strengthen your ability to make your voice heard at the ballot box, Democrats aren't letting up efforts to protect the sacred right to vote. Democracy depends on every American having a voice.
https://t.co/P1GgbeiXWv
Free at-home COVID tests are available for direct delivery to every American household. It takes only a minute to place your order now: https://t.co/UmfIFY3QhZ
Proud to join the @Citypittsburgca community today in commemorating the life and work of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. We must continue to honor this legacy today and every day. https://t.co/x6bAdY3or7

Our office had the honor of attending @cityofelcerrito Caravan Parade today in observance of MLK Day. Our community is proud to honor the legacy of Dr. King and continue his work toward racial equity and justice. https://t.co/ZOfSR2TVzy

Today we honor the life of Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., a true leader who devoted his life to promoting racial justice and equity. Let us reflect today on the legacy of Dr. King and my friend, the late Congressman John Lewis, and recommit ourselves to the pursuit of justice. #MLK https://t.co/oELnByXbBc
For the latest alerts or you need assistance, we encourage you to follow @Cal_OES.

The @NWS_PTWC has issued a Tsunami Advisory for the entire California coast following the large volcanic eruption near Tonga and is urging people located in the coastal area to move off the beach and out of harbors and marinas. https://t.co/6XyQu05tfP

This week we took action in Congress to protect the sacred right to vote. In Contra Costa, we continued our efforts to support families through education and child care, and celebrated the unveiling of a new community crisis response system that will help save lives. https://t.co/CK6r8xcAl6

ICYMI: Our office is proud to work with @CCCounty in supporting behavioral health services through programs like the newly-unveiled A3, a community crisis initiative that will help save lives.
https://t.co/dfyoX9k9WY

This free, family-friendly event will celebrate the life of Dr. King with a day of community service and include live music, activities for children, and a chance to learn about sustainable agriculture and food justice.

On January 17 10 am-2pm, @UrbanTilth and Friends of the Richmond Greenway are hosting “Passion and Perseverance: A MLK Day Celebration at the Richmond Greenway.” 
https://t.co/kKr5mCi8lA

The Freedom to Vote: John Lewis Act is about making it easier for Americans to vote. Today we faced a setback in this endeavor, but we are more determined than ever and we will not let up our efforts to ensure everyone has a voice in our democracy. https://t.co/L8UK6E04vl

This bill would stand against GOP attacks on voting and our elections by:
✔️Expanding automatic voter registration
✔️Strengthening vote by mail & early voting
✔️Making Election Day a national holiday
✔️Ending partisan gerrymandering & more

I just proudly cast my vote in support of the Freedom to Vote: John Lewis Act, a bill that would protect the right of every American to vote & make their voice heard. The Senate must honor the legacy of Dr. King & John Lewis and do whatever it takes to pass this bill. https://t.co/EzjDwZzFF3

I am proud of our County for taking these necessary steps & of our shared work to #EndTheStigma & ensure every resident gets the support they need. I've also been fighting in Congress for funding that would help to expand these services & look forward to continuing those efforts.

Contra Costa is working to support behavioral health of our community through a new program called Anyone, Anywhere, Anytime (A3) that will offer services to those in mental health emergencies. 
https://t.co/WKtg89vAnp https://t.co/A7xfLJBQ29

It’s past time we ensure the men and women who serve our country receive the full benefits they deserve. I was proud to vote yes today for the Guard and Reserve GI Bill Parity Act because #EveryDayInUniformCounts.

✔️Secured $550 billion for infrastructure projects across the country. This funding will be used to increase accessibility to EV charging stations, improve railways, & create millions of well-paying jobs. This funding also allocates $4.5 billion for BART to upgrade transit lines.

✔️Expanded the Child Tax Credit to cut child poverty in half

✔️Expanded ACA coverage and slashed prescription drug costs for seniors

✔️Secured more than $3.6 billion in COVID relief funding for Contra Costa. This includes $3 billion to support small businesses, $202.5 million to provide health services to our community, and $38.7 million to keep residents in their homes during the pandemic.
